diverse_beam_strength is a tuple, but does not currently support tuples. Are you expanding diverse beam search? Or is it wrong to be a tuple?
fairseq/fairseq/tasks/fairseq_task.py
Line 247 in 3335de5
diverse_beam_strength = (getattr(args, "diverse_beam_strength", 0.5),)
fairseq/fairseq/search.py
Line 114 in 244835d
self.diversity_strength = -diversity_strength
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (master):

comments.comment: I removed the brackets and the comma, and it seemed to work. diverse_beam_strength = (getattr(args, "diverse_beam_strength", 0.5),) ==> diverse_beam_strength = getattr(args, "diverse_beam_strength", 0.5)

Yes, this was a bug introduced in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/commit/fab2e86e51f48301146a37fc86d01fdbf5e8a5f2>fab2e86</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Nickeilf>@Nickeilf</denchmark-link> 's fix is correct, I'll submit a PR for it shortly.
